summary: 08/19/1993: Seven tourists -- two Germans, two Italians, two Swiss nationals and a New Zealander -- were kidnapped in eastern Turkey on August 19 by hardliners from the main Kurdish rebel party, the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK). They were released on 09/14/1993.
target1: Tourists from Germany (2), Italy (2), Switzerland (2) and New Zealand (1)
scite1: “Kurdish rebels release foreign tourists: reports," Agence France Presse, September 14, 1993.
scite2: “Kurdish rebels release foreign tourist: ministries," Agence France Presse, September 14, 1993
scite3: “Seven captured tourists freed in Turkey," Agence France Presse, September 14, 1993.
